Divers swim into a shoal of predatory Humboldt squid as the creatures emerge from the depths to hunt in packs, time-lapse photography reveals thousands of starfish gathering under the Arctic ice to devour a seal carcass, and a giant octopus protects her eggs by using her body to wall up a cave, starving to death in the process.

Now they have taken the decision to release some of the video footage and share her account with the world.

programme.title: The Truth About Lions
programme.desc: Lion expert and presenter Jonathan Scott investigates the most famous lion pride in the world: the Marsh Pride of the Masai Mara in east Africa. Jonathan's intimate knowledge of this massive pride and their various subgroups helps him explore the possible reasons for the lion's social lifestyle. While there are some apparent benefits to living in prides, from cooperative hunting to raising cubs, none appear to be a reason enough to evolve social living.

The groomers must also identify the parent breeds of a number of crossbreeds, and a dramatic transformation takes place on the dogwalk when the dogs take the shape of completely different animals, to the delight of their owners.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: At Cape Town's famous Kirstenbosch Botanic Gardens Monty sees the king protea, South Africa's national plant, then in the Drakensberg Mountains he sees some native flora in its natural environment. His favourite garden is a school vegetable patch in Thembisa, one of Johannesburg's townships. Monty is intrigued by how gardening styles have changed here since the Dutch first settled in the 19th century.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Period drama based on Jane Austen's classic novel about the five husband-hunting Bennet sisters and the impact of the handsome but apparently aloof Mr Darcy on the spirited Elizabeth.

programme.title: Jane Austen: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the different houses in which Jane Austen lived and stayed, to discover just how much they shaped Jane's life and novels. The result is a revealing insight into one of the world's best-loved authors.

programme.title: Brideshead Revisited
programme.desc: Middle-class Oxford student Charles Ryder becomes entranced with the rich family of his friend, Lord Sebastian Flyte. When he falls for Sebastian's sister, however, repressed passions and archaic social mores complicate the affair.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: All the results and reports from today's football fixtures, including reaction to the day's early Premier League game between Manchester City and West Ham. Presented by Jason Mohammad.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The teams visit 19th-century Highcliffe Castle in Dorset, which has been restored with all kinds of ingenious methods. Adam Partridge and Phillip Serrell are the experts, and finds include an untouched World War II ration pack and a piece of modern design by Edward Paolozzi. Presenter Paul Martin goes to Blandford Forum Camp to find out about the remarkable work of the Royal Corps of Signals since World War I.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: It's Week Four, and six interior designers remain. After three tough challenges and two designers leaving last week, the competition is heating up.This week, the designers are tasked with transforming shop interiors., including a pet accessories shop, a camera store and a kitchen equipment retailer.

programme.title: Perry and Croft: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at the end of eras and the beginnings of new identities, and how the situation comedies of Jimmy Perry and David Croft reflected old ideas as they faded and a new British identity as it was being forged.

programme.title: My Hero: Hugh Dennis on Ronnie Barker
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis explores the career of his comedy inspiration, Ronnie Barker. Starting in Ronnie's childhood home, Hugh follows Ronnie's path from the London stage to TV stardom. On his journey Hugh unearths original scripts penned by Ronnie himself, meets people who worked with him behind the scenes, and finds a fresh appreciation of one of our most unassuming comedy greats.

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The crew use their rifles and their wits to compete for the honour of guarding a VIP.

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Made in Scotland
programme.desc: A look at the life and influences of Billy Connolly, featuring Eddie Izzard, Ross Noble, Micky Flanagan, Lord Grade, Tracey Ullman, AL Kennedy, Val McDermid, Sharleen Spiteri and Eddi Reader, showing a true reflection of his far influence.

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Made in Scotland
programme.desc: Billy goes back to the Scotland of his childhood where he reveals that knitted woolly swimming trunks were not a figment of his imagination. Featuring personal accounts and interviews from famous faces in Billy's life.

programme.title: Apocalypse Now
programme.desc: In Vietnam in 1970, Captain Willard takes a perilous and increasingly hallucinatory journey upriver to find and terminate Colonel Kurtz, a once-promising officer who has reportedly gone completely mad. In the company of a Navy patrol boat filled with street-smart kids, a surfing-obsessed Air Cavalry officer, and a crazed freelance photographer, Willard travels further and further into the heart of darkness.

programme.title: Frantz
programme.desc: Anna is a bereft young German woman whose fiance, Frantz, was killed in the trenches of World War I. Adrien, a French veteran of the war, makes a mysterious appearance in her town, placing flowers on Frantz's grave. Adrien's presence is met with resistance by the small community still reeling from Germany's defeat, yet Anna gradually becomes closer to the handsome and melancholy young man, as she learns of his deep friendship with Frantz.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

With three ambitious new projects planned this year, they hope to not only win their first ever gold award, but also to put their forgotten seaside town back on the map and encourage tourists to visit.

Tom also meets a sheepdog turned search-and-rescue hero and gets hands-on with a project that has unearthed evidence of riverside residents dating back to Neolithic times. Adam is hoping for good news from his ewes as, thanks to scanning, he discovers how many are in lamb.

His walk takes him from the village of Abergwyngregyn to the quay at Conwy.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: In 1978, `Top of the Pops' began to turn the credibility corner. It seemed the kids' time had come again for the first time since glam rock, yet the biggest-selling singles of 1978 were by the likes of Boney M, John Travolta and Olivia Newton John, Rod Stewart, the Bee Gees and Abba. Along came a generation of young post-punk and new wave bands ready to storm the `Top of the Pops' stage.

programme.title: Dave Allen: The Immaculate Selection
programme.desc: An anthology of Dave Allen's finest, funniest and most irreverent material, compiled from his time at the BBC from 1971 to 1986.

programme.title: Mindhorn
programme.desc: A has-been actor, known for playing British detective Mindhorn, works alongside the police to catch a serial killer who will only speak to Mindhorn, whom he believes to be real.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A pick `n' mix of `Top of the Pops' classics from 1978, when in-yer-face punk and new wave rebellion co-existed with MOR suburban pop, disco fever, soul balladry, reggae and prog rock, and when two mega-successful movie soundtracks in the shape of Grease and Saturday Night Fever squared up on the dancefloor. Featuring shouty Sham 69, the cool rebellion of Ian Dury, Elvis Costello and Blondie.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris heads to Shrewsbury in Shropshire where the Bloomers have been taking part in the floral competition for 37 years. Backed by the council, this gold-winning team have a big budget and plant a staggering 300,000 flowers every year in their town.

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Christine Walkden floats over the landlocked Midlands county of Staffordshire. At Biddulph Grange she takes to the water to help remove some unwelcome guests and meets Helen, the `heart of the garden'. At Shugborough Hall she rallies the troops for a spot of tree hugging, and we discover how the area's proud industrial heritage shaped the county's landscape.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week Anita Rani is on her home turf in London, showing that you don't need to go far for a healthy dose of green. Anita is taken on an enchanting tour of one of London's `magnificent seven' cemeteries, as she discovers a trove of treasures right on her doorstep and sets out to crack the mystery of a non-native bird. Adam Henson shows us how he concocts a super-meal for his animals during the winter months.

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: It's a walk down memory lane for weatherman Derek Brockway as he climbs the Nash Point lighthouse he used to visit as a child. Derek's coastal walk takes him along the `Jurassic' Glamorgan coastline.

programme.title: Live: European Indoor Championship Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage from the final day's action at the European Athletics Indoor Championships in Poland. Sunday's schedule is action-packed, with 14 medals handed out - can Britain's best athletes help themselves to some silverware in Torun? At the 2019 championships in Glasgow, the GB team claimed 12 medals in total, with the likes of Tim Duckworth catching the eye with heptathlon silver.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from `Saturday Kitchen'.

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Tracey and Jake have a decent-sized, south-facing garden in West Sussex, but the space simply doesn't work for their family. As a full time wheelchair user, Tracey struggles to navigate the tricky slopes and awkward drops of the garden.

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Gardeners are said to be generous people who love a bargain, none more so than Mairi Reid in Ardersier. This is the story of how Mairi gardens for pleasure and to feed her family for almost no cost. Mairi doesn't have the space in her own garden to grow food so has struck up a fruitful and inspirational partnership with friends and neighbours to share land, knowledge and produce. Get your notepads ready for a programme full of tips of how to garden beautifully on a budget.

programme.title: Live: European Indoor Championship Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage from the final session at the European Athletics Indoor Championships in Poland. There are 12 gold medals in total to be handed out across a hectic evening in Torun - all brought to a thrilling conclusion with the men's and women's 4x400m relays. The men's 800m final is set to be the standout race of the evening - not least because of the incredible performances in 2021 by Britain's Elliot Giles, who will be gunning for gold in Torun.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon and his team are in the stunning Somerset levels, working with Vicki and Bryan. The couple dreams of spending less time at work and more time with their young family by turning a corner of their field into a unique B&B.

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon is in the United States travelling down the Rocky Mountains from Montana to Colorado. In wide open prairies of Montana, the cowboy way of life is under threat from a long term decline in the rural economy but Simon meets a former Silicon Valley executive who has envisaged a new future for the land.

programme.title: Chris Packham Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris reveals some of the best animal builders in the world, a group that is incredibly varied. Accomplished animal architects include everything from beavers to bees and prairie dogs to bowerbirds.

programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan mulls over the week's most entertaining news with celebrity guests Roisin Conaty and Jamie Laing, his mum and his very own rambunctious focus group, the Ranganation.

If Simon and his entourage of one can get in with the right DC people, and if they can stop the PM's chief spin-doctor Malcolm Tucker rigging the vote at the UN, then maybe they can halt the war.

programme.desc: The story of the infamous 1970 Miss World contest, when protestors dramatically disrupted the event, kickstarting a feminist revolution in front of an audience of millions. Smuggling themselves into the event, they brought the show to a sudden halt, shouting 'we're not beautiful, we're not ugly, we're angry'.
